Items.Title: Roll Call
Invocation
Items.AgendaNote:
Delivered by:  Father William F. Krlis Pastor, St. Leo's Church, 104-19 49th Avenue, Corona, N.Y.  11368

Motion to spread the invocation in full upon the record by Council Member Sears.
Items.MinutesNote:
The Invocation was delivered by: Father William F. Krlis Pastor, St. Leo's Church, 104-19 49th Avenue, Corona, N.Y. 11368.

Council Member Sears moved to spread the Invocation in full upon the Record.

Items.Title: Adoption of Minutes
Messages & Papers from the Mayor

Communication from the Mayor  -  “AN ACT to amend the vehicle and traffic law and the public officers law, in relation to establishing in each city with a population of one million or more a demonstration program to enforce maximum speed limits by means of speed limit photo devices; and  providing  for the repeal of such provisions upon expiration thereof.” A.7142 / S.3993
Items.ActionText: This Mayor's Message was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on State and Federal Legislation
Items.MatterName: Amend the vehicle and traffic law and the public officers law (S.3993, A.7142).

Items.Title: Communication from the Mayor  -  “AN ACT to amend the education law and the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to the transfer of the members, assets and liabilities of the board of education retirement system of such city to the New York city employees' retirement system and the teachers' retirement system of such city.” A.7452 / S.4483
Items.ActionText: This Mayor's Message was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on State and Federal Legislation
Items.MatterName:
Amend the education law and the administrative code of the city of New York  (S.4483, 
A.7452).

Items.Title:
Communication from the Office of the City Clerk – Submitting the Certificate of the swearing in of Mathieu Eugene, as the new Council Member of the 40th Council District, Kings County.

THE CITY CLERK AND CLERK OF THE COUNCIL PERFORMS THE FORMAL CEREMONY OF THE ELECTED COUNCIL MEMBER MATHIEU EUGENE TAKING HIS OATH OF OFFICE
Items.ActionName: Rcvd, Ord, Prnt, Fld by Council
Items.ActionText: This Communication was Rcvd, Ord, Prnt, Fld by Council
Items.MatterName: Submitting the Certificate of the swearing in of Mathieu Eugene, as the new Council Member of the 40th Council District, Kings County.

Items.Title: Petitions and Communications
Land Use Call-Ups

By The Speaker (Council Member Quinn):
Pursuant to Rule 11.20(b) of the Council and Section 20-225(g) of the New York City Administrative Code, the Council resolves that the action of the Department of Consumer Affairs approving an unenclosed sidewalk café located at 22 East 54th Street, Application no. 20075274 TCM shall be subject to review by the Council.
Items.ActionText: A motion was made that this Land Use Call-Up be Approved, by Council approved by Roll Call.
Items.MatterName: Sidewalk Cafe, 22 East 54th Street, Manhattan (20075274TCM)

Items.Title: Communication from the Speaker
Discussion of General Orders
Reports of Special Committees
Reports of Standing Committees

Resolution supporting S.201, also known as the “9/11 Heroes Health Improvement Act of 2007”, to establish a grant program for individuals still suffering ill health effects as a result of the September 11, 2001 attacks on the World Trade Center and the Pentagon.
Items.AgendaNote: Adopted by the Committee on Civil Service and Labor
Items.MinutesNote:
Pursuant to Rule 8.50 of the Council, the Public Advocate (Ms. Gotbaum) called for a voice vote.  Hearing no objections, the Public Advocate (Ms. Gotbaum) declared the Resolution to be adopted.

Adopted unanimously by the Council by voice-vote.
Items.ActionText: A motion was made that this Resolution be Approved, by Council approved by Voice Vote.
Items.MatterName: 9/11 Heroes Health Improvement Act of 2007

INTRODUCTION AND READING OF BILLS

State Legislation Resolution requesting the New York State Legislature to pass bills introduced by Senator Maltese, S.809, and Assembly Member Abbate, A.1530, “AN ACT to amend the general municipal law, in relation to certain heart disabilities incurred by deputy sheriff members of the New York city employees’ retirement system in certain cases and providing for the repeal of such provisions upon expiration thereof”.
Items.ActionText: This SLR was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on State and Federal Legislation
Items.MatterName: Heart disabilities incurred by deputy sheriff members of NYCERS (S.809, A.1530).

Items.Title: State Legislation Resolution requesting the New York State Legislature to pass bills introduced by Senator Padavan, S.3315, and Assembly Member Abbate, A.5781, “AN ACT to amend the civil service law, in relation to suspension of employees of the department of parks in cities having a population of one million or more”.
Items.ActionText: This SLR was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on State and Federal Legislation
Items.MatterName: Suspension of parks department employees in cities with one million plus population (S.3315, A.5781).

Items.Title: State Legislation Resolution requesting the New York State Legislature to pass bills introduced by Senator Padavan, S.3314, and Assembly Member Abbate, A.5961, “AN ACT to amend the retirement and social security law and the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to coverage for additional members of the New York city employees’ retirement system”.
Items.ActionText: This SLR was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on State and Federal Legislation
Items.MatterName: Coverage for additional members of NYCERS (S.3314, A.5961).

Items.Title: State Legislation Resolution requesting the New York State Legislature to pass bills introduced by Senator Smith, S.1861, and Assembly Member Cook, A.3548, “AN ACT authorizing the city of New York to reconvey its interest in certain real property acquired by in rem tax foreclosure in the borough of Queens to former owner Morris Brown Church, notwithstanding expiration of the two year period within which application may be made to the city to release its interest in property thus acquired; Block No. 12048, Lot No. 85 on tax map for the borough of Queens”.
Items.ActionText: This SLR was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on State and Federal Legislation
Items.MatterName: In rem, Morris Brown Church, block 12048, Lot 85, Queens (S.1861, A.3548).

Items.Title: State Legislation Resolution requesting the New York State Legislature to pass bills introduced by Senator Padavan, S.3876, and Assembly Member Abbate, A.6513, “AN ACT to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to the powers, duties and responsibilities of the board of trustees of the New York city fire department pension fund, subchapter two and in relation to authorizing such board of trustees to draw upon the assets of such pension fund to pay expenses”.
Items.ActionText: This SLR was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on State and Federal Legislation
Items.MatterName: FDNY Pension Fund, Board of Trustees (S.3876, A.6513).

Items.Title: State Legislation Resolution requesting the New York State Legislature to pass bills introduced by Senator Maltese, S.3598, and Assembly Member Abbate, A.6537, “AN ACT to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to terminal leave”.
Items.ActionText: This SLR was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Standards and Ethics
Items.MatterName: Terminal leave (S.3598, A.6537).

Items.Title: State Legislation Resolution requesting the New York State Legislature to pass bills introduced by Senator Padavan, S.3928, and Assembly Member Abbate, A.6707, “AN ACT to amend the retirement and social security law, in relation to increased take-home pay contributions made on behalf of certain members of the New York City’s public retirement systems”.
Items.ActionText: This SLR was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on State and Federal Legislation
Items.MatterName: Increased take-home pay contributions (S.3928, A.6707).

Items.Title: State Legislation Resolution requesting the New York State Legislature to pass bills introduced by Senator Padavan, S.4412, and Assembly Member Abbate, A.7385, “AN ACT to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to the twenty-year retirement program established for members of the New York city employees’ retirement system employed as investigators by the district attorneys’ offices”.
Items.ActionText: This SLR was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on State and Federal Legislation
Items.MatterName: NYCERS twenty year program for investigators of DA's offices (S.4412, A.7385).

Items.Title: State Legislation Resolution requesting the New York State Legislature to pass bills introduced by Senator Golden, S.4894, and Assembly Member Abbate, A.7063, “AN ACT to amend the retirement and social security law, in relation to the application of the age fifty-seven retirement program, the mandated physically taxing program, and the incumbent fifty-five/twenty-five program for certain employees”.
Items.ActionText: This SLR was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on State and Federal Legislation
Items.MatterName: 57 retirement program, physically taxing program, 55/25 program (S.4894, A.7063).

Items.Title: State Legislation Resolution requesting the New York State Legislature to pass bills introduced by Senator Lanza, S.3274, and Assembly Member Lentol, A.5055, “AN ACT to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to extending the benefits of the variable supplements fund for housing police and transit police members of the New York city employees’ retirement system”.
Items.ActionText: This SLR was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on State and Federal Legislation
Items.MatterName: Benefits of variable supplements for housing police and transit police of NYCERS (S.3274, A.5055).

Items.Title: State Legislation Resolution requesting the New York State Legislature to pass bills introduced by Senator Maltese, S.5739, and Assembly Member Abbate, A.6171, “AN ACT to authorize certain employees to elect participation in an optional retirement plan”.
Items.ActionText: This SLR was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on State and Federal Legislation
Items.MatterName: Elect participation in an optional retirement plan (S.5739, A.6171).

Items.Title: State Legislation Resolution requesting the New York State Legislature to pass bills introduced by Senator Maltese, S.1990, and Assembly Member Abbate, A.3867, “AN ACT to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to terminal leave”.
Items.ActionText: This SLR was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on State and Federal Legislation
Items.MatterName: Terminal leave (S.1990, A.3867).

Items.Title: State Legislation Resolution requesting the New York State Legislature to pass bills introduced by Senator Lanza, S.3661, and Assembly Member Abbate, A.6236, “AN ACT to amend the general municipal law, in relation to certain lung disabilities incurred by members of the uniformed force of sanitation departments in certain cities”.
Items.ActionText: This SLR was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on State and Federal Legislation
Items.MatterName: Lung disabilites incurred by uniformed members of sanitation force (S.3661, A.6236).

Items.Title: State Legislation Resolution requesting the New York State Legislature to pass bills introduced by Senator Padavan, S.3875, and Assembly Member Abbate, A.6175, “AN ACT to amend the retirement and social security law and the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to permitting certain New York city sanitation members to borrow from their accumulated member contributions and to repeal certain provisions of the retirement and social security law relating thereto”.
Items.ActionText: This SLR was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on State and Federal Legislation
Items.MatterName: Sanitation members borrowing from accumulated contributions (S.3875, A.6175).

Items.Title: State Legislation Resolution requesting the New York State Legislature to pass bills introduced by Senator Padavan, S.4495, and Assembly Member Abbate, A.6176, “AN ACT to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to establishing a variable supplements fund for sanitation members of the New York city employees’ retirement system holding the title of sanitation worker”.
Items.ActionText: This SLR was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on State and Federal Legislation
Items.MatterName: Estabilishing a variable suppelments fund for sanitation workers (S.4495, A.6176).

Items.Title: State Legislation Resolution requesting the New York State Legislature to pass bills introduced by Senator Lanza, S.5133, and Assembly Member Abbate, A.6177, “AN ACT to amend the retirement and social security law, in relation to disability benefits of New York city sanitation members”.
Items.ActionText: This SLR was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on State and Federal Legislation
Items.MatterName: Disabilitiy benefits of NYC sanitation members (S.5133, A.6177).

Items.MatterName: Civil penalties for violations of the littering law.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to permits for responsible food service establishments.
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Health
Items.MatterName: Permits for responsible food service establishments.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to requiring the Department of Health and Mental Hygiene to post on its website in a user-friendly format and disseminate certain information mandated by the Maternity Information Act of 1989 (New York State Public Health Law § 2803-j).
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Health
Items.MatterName: Requiring the Dep't of Health and Mental Hygiene to post on its website in a user-friendly format and disseminate certain information mandated by the Maternity Information Act of 1989 (New York State Public Health Law § 2803-j).

Items.Title: Resolution calling upon the State Legislature to amend the Public Authorities Law in relation to siting requirements for the New York City School Construction Authority’s Leasing Program.
Items.ActionText: This Resolution was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Education
Items.MatterName: State Legislature to amend the Public Authorities Law in relation to siting requirements for the NYC School Construction Authority’s Leasing Program.

Items.Title: Resolution calling upon the New York City Department of Education to maintain a minimum level of arts funding in New York City public schools.
Items.ActionText: This Resolution was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Education
Items.MatterName: Department of Education to maintain a minimum level of arts funding in NYC public schools.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to payments to city contractors by electronic funds transfer.
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Contracts
Items.MatterName: Payments to city contractors by electronic funds transfer.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the New York city charter, in relation to authorizing the department of transportation to extend the expiration date of the operating authority of certain unsubsidized private bus services.
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Land Use
Items.MatterName: Authorizing the department of transportation to extend the expiration date of the operating authority of certain unsubsidized private bus services.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to prohibiting the sale or possession of pistols or revolvers that do not meet safety and quality standards established by the Police Commissioner.
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Public Safety
Items.MatterName: Prohibiting the sale or possession of pistols or revolvers that do not meet safety and quality standards established by the Police Commissioner.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to requiring owners to notify tenants of unsafe conditions of exterior walls of buildings.
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Housing and Buildings
Items.MatterName: Requiring owners to notify tenants of unsafe conditions of exterior walls of buildings.

Items.Title: Resolution urging the United States Congress to pass legislation that would to amend the Public Health Service Act with respect to facilitating the development of microbicides for preventing transmission of HIV and other diseases.
Items.ActionText: This Resolution was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Health
Items.MatterName: Congress to pass legislation that would to amend the Public Health Service Act.

Items.Title: Resolution calling upon the United States Senate to pass, and for New York Senators Charles Schumer and Hillary Clinton to support, Rep. Peter King’s “John Doe” amendment that would provide civil immunity to people who report suspicious behavior in the name of national security.
Items.ActionText: This Resolution was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Public Safety
Items.MatterName: “John Doe” amendment that would provide civil immunity to people who report suspicious behavior in the name of national security.

Items.Title: Resolution calling upon the State Legislature and the Governor to enact A. 7012, legislation authorizing the City to reinstate the modest charge on non-residents who work in the City for their use of City services, also known as the “commuter tax”.
Items.ActionText: This Resolution was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Finance
Items.MatterName: Commuter Tax (A.7021)

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to the provision of certified birth certificates for certain people being released from a New York city or state correctional facility.
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Fire and Criminal Justice Services
Items.MatterName: The abolition of fees for certified birth certificates for any person who is being released from a NYS correctional facility, after any duration, and any person who is being released from a NYC jail after at least 90 consecutive days of incarceration.

Items.Title: Resolution urging the United States Congress to end federal raids to deport undocumented immigrants and institute comprehensive immigration reform that protects the fundamental civil liberties of immigrants and integrates immigrants fully into American society.
Items.ActionText: This Resolution was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Immigration
Items.MatterName: Congress to end federal raids to deport undocumented immigrants and institute comprehensive immigration reform that protects the fundamental civil liberties of immigrants and integrates immigrants fully into American society.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to the possession and sale of graffiti instruments.
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Public Safety
Items.MatterName: Possession and sale of graffiti instruments.

Items.MinutesNote: The presence of a quorum was announced by The Public Advocate (Ms. Gotbaum).
The Public Advocate (Ms. Gotbaum) put the question whether the Council would agree with and adopt such motion which was decided in the affirmative by the following vote:
At this point, the Public Advocate (Ms. Gotbaum) declared that the aforementioned items were adopted and referred to the Committee on Land Use and to the appropriate Land Use Subcommittee.
At this point the Speaker (Council Member Quinn) made the following annoucements:

Whereupon on motion of the Speaker (Council Member Quinn), the Clerk of the Council adjourned to meet again on Wednesday, May 30, 2007.

VICTOR L. ROBLES, City Clerk
Clerk of the Council
The Public Advocate (Ms. Gotbaum) put the question whether the Council would agree with and adopt such reports, which were decided in the affirmative by the following vote:

Items.MinutesNote: At this point, Mathieu Eugene took his oath of office as the new Council Member representing the 40th Council District in Brooklyn.  The formal swearing-in ceremony was performed by the City Clerk and Clerk of the Council (Mr. Robles).
(Mathieu Eugene was formally sworn-in as a Council Member later in the Meeting and is included in the Roll Calls for Attendance, Land Use Call-ups and General Orders)
